definition[0]: to leave someone by walking away from them, especially in a rude or angry way
example[0]: Don’t just walk off when I’m trying to talk to you!
definition[1]: if you walk off an illness or unpleasant feeling, you go for a walk to make it go away
note[0]: walk off dinner/a meal etc (=go for a walk so that your stomach feels less full)
example[1]: Let’s go out – maybe I can walk this headache off.
definition[2]: to stop working as a protest
example[2]: Without new contracts, mine workers will walk off their jobs Thursday.
